titleStmt.title: The life and death of King Charles the first written by Dr. R. Perinchief: together with Eikon basilike. Representing His Sacred Majesty in his solitudes and sufferings. And a vindication of the same King Charles the martyr. Proving him to be the author of the said Eikon basilike, against a memorandum of the late earl of Anglesey, and against the groundless exceptons of Dr. Walker and others.
The royal martyr: or, the life and death of King Charles I.
titleStmt.author: Perrinchief, Richard, 1623?-1673.

titleStmt.title: The life and death of King Charles the first written by Dr. R. Perinchief: together with Eikon basilike. Representing His Sacred Majesty in his solitudes and sufferings. And a vindication of the same King Charles the martyr. Proving him to be the author of the said Eikon basilike, against a memorandum of the late earl of Anglesey, and against the groundless exceptons of Dr. Walker and others.
The royal martyr: or, the life and death of King Charles I.
titleStmt.author: Perrinchief, Richard, 1623?-1673.
White, Robert, 1600-1690, engraver.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for H. Hindmarsh, at the Golden-Ball over against the Royal Exchange,

notesStmt.note: The title words "Eikon basilike" transliterated from Greek.
Another edition of: The royal martyr: or, the life and death of King Charles I.
The epistle dedicatory signed: Richard Royston.
Running title reads: The life of Charles I.
With allegorical portrait frontispiece signed: R. White sculp.
Copy imperfect; does not include the Eikon basilike.
Reproduction of the original in the Christ Church Library, Oxford University.
